main event: A bright light blue object, which split into two objects with a tail, was sighted over La Jolla Beach, California.
interesting points: The object(s) were the size of a pin, with blue and white lights, and moved in a straight flight path.
The object(s) were observed for about 20 seconds.
The report indicates that the description and duration of the sighting suggest it was likely a meteor.
Other sightings of similar objects were reported in the area prior to this incident.
The report mentions that the object(s) caught air and seemed to have little weight.
sighted object: One or two bright light blue objects with a tail
witnesses: Multiple witnesses, including Capt. D. Yori, Jr. and others
photographs: Yes, the report indicates that photographs were taken
